chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Bodily Harm)
Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Bodily Harm)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Shamyracle L Cummins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child -Specified Harm Did Not Occur, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 p.m. on 8/16/2022.
Probation review hearing November 11, 2022 at 1:30 p.m.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge during the period of probation.  Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.  Any cash bail on deposit to apply if applicable.
Court waived all other court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Court set restitution at zero.

Complete parenting classes.
Cooperate with child protective services or any other Children's Court order put in to place.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child -Specified Harm Did Not Occur

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shamyracle L Cummins

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shamyracle L Cummins in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for Plea/Sentencing hearing.

Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

As to Count 2: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 2: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 0 days served. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- As to Count 2: Serve 90 days condition time in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Complete Parenting Classes.
- 25 hours of comunity service.
- Obtain/maintain employment or education.
- Cooperate with child protective services or any other children's court order put in to place.
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges, including the  DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Any cash bail on deposit to apply if applicable.
- Court set restitution at zero.
- Defendant is eligible for expungement. 

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 08/16/2022.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Received and Filed. Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights

Defendant Shamyracle L Cummins in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Shamyracle L Cummins in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  
Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  State is still waiting for medical records and requests another scheduling conference date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shamyracle L Cummins in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: James Hunter - MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, CPAU No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TAB Jr. unless the visitation is pursuant to DMCPS discretion, or Childrens Court TPC/Dispositional Order (whichever is superseding). If DMCPS closes out their investigation and Children's Court has no open orders, this order is to convert into a No Violent Contact Order.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Shamyracle L Cummins in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/15/22 @ 1:30p
